Description

<b>SpaceCaves</b> is a retro-styled 2D twin-stick shooter with elements from stealth games, roguelikes and RPGs.

History

I used to be an AI researcher, and one of the projects I worked on was the <a href="http://www.ptsp-game.net/">Physical Travelling Salesman Problem</a>, where the aim is to pilot an Asteroids-like spaceship around a maze as quickly as possible. But then I came to think: What if you could just blast your way through the walls of the maze? And what if the mazes were randomly generated? And what if there were enemies trying to kill you as well, but you had the option of out-stealthing them? And why, when every other indie game boasts of "retro-styled graphics", doesn't the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vectrex">Vectrex</a> get any love? SpaceCaves is my answer to all of these questions and more.

Features

  • Procedurally generated levels -- no two playthroughs are the same
  • Fully destructible levels with realistic 2D physics
  • Retro Vectrex-style graphics, because pixels are boring and vectors are awesome
  • Billions of procedurally generated enemy species, all with unique and challenging AI
  • Huge skill tree, roguelike play time -- all of the customisation, none of the grind
  • Ragdoll physics!
  • Play your way -- Will you take out enemies with deadly accuracy? Slip by them stealthily? Or just obliterate everything in your path?

About Orange Helicopter

Boilerplate
Orange Helicopter is a one-man games studio, founded by former game AI researcher Ed Powley, and based in York, UK.
